2024-01-15.title: Priscilla
2024-01-15.synopsis: When teenage Priscilla Beaulieu meets Elvis Presley at a party, the man who is already a meteoric rock-and-roll superstar becomes someone entirely unexpected in private moments: a thrilling crush, an ally in loneliness, a vulnerable best friend. Through Priscilla’s eyes, Sofia Coppola tells the unseen side of a great American myth in Elvis and Priscilla's long courtship and turbulent marriage, from a German army base to his dream-world estate at Graceland, in this deeply felt and ravishingly detailed portrait of love, fantasy, and fame.

2024-01-15.title: Poor Things
2024-01-15.synopsis: From filmmaker Yorgos Lanthimos and producer Emma Stone comes the incredible tale and fantastical evolution of Bella Baxter (Stone), a young woman brought back to life by the brilliant and unorthodox scientist Dr. Godwin Baxter (Dafoe).

2024-01-15.title: Chicken Run: Dawn of the Nugget
2024-01-15.synopsis: After escaping from Tweedy's farm, Ginger and all the chickens living the dream in their peaceful island sanctuary, far from the dangers of the human world.

2024-01-15.title: Napoleon
2024-01-15.synopsis: Napoleon is a spectacle-filled action epic that details the checkered rise and fall of the iconic French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, played by Oscar®-winner Joaquin Phoenix. Against a stunning backdrop of large-scale filmmaking orchestrated by legendary director Ridley Scott, the film captures Bonaparte's relentless journey to power through the prism of his addictive, volatile relationship with his one true love, Josephine, showcasing his visionary military and political tactics against some of the most dynamic practical battle sequences ever filmed.

2024-01-15.title: The Boy And The Heron (Subtitled)
2024-01-15.synopsis: A young boy named Mahito yearning for his mother ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. A semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation, in tribute to friendship from the mind of Hayao Miyazaki.

2024-01-15.title: The Kitchen
2024-01-15.synopsis: In a dystopian London, the gap between rich and poor has been stretched to its limits. All forms of social housing have been eradicated and only The Kitchen remains. A community that refuses to move out of the place they call home. This is where we meet a solitary Izi, living here by necessity and desperately trying to find a way out, and a 12-year-old Benji, who has lost his mother and is searching for a family. We follow our unlikely pair as they struggle to forge a relationship in a system that is stacked against them.

2024-01-15.title: Saltburn
2024-01-15.synopsis: Struggling to find his place at Oxford University, student Oliver Quick finds himself drawn into the world of the charming and aristocratic Felix Catton, who invites him to Saltburn, his eccentric family's sprawling estate, for a summer never to be forgotten.

2024-01-15.title: Anyone But You
2024-01-15.synopsis: In the comedy Anyone But You, Bea (Sydney Sweeney) and Ben (Glen Powell) look like the perfect couple, but after an amazing first date something happens that turns their fiery hot attraction ice cold - until they find themselves unexpectedly thrust together at a destination wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-01-15.title: Wonka
2024-01-15.synopsis: The Story will focus on a young Willy Wonka and his adventures prior to opening the world’s most famous chocolate factory.

2024-01-15.title: Boys in the Boat
2024-01-15.synopsis: A 1930s-set story centered on the University of Washington's rowing team, from their Depression-era beginnings to winning gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

2024-01-15.title: One Life
2024-01-15.synopsis: Follows British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

2024-01-15.title: Ferrari
2024-01-15.synopsis: It is the summer of 1957. Behind the spectacle of Formula 1, ex-racer Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy threatens the factory he and his wife, Laura built from nothing ten years earlier. Their volatile marriage has been battered by the loss of their son, Dino a year earlier. Ferrari struggles to acknowledge his son Piero with Lina Lardi. Meanwhile, his drivers’ passion to win pushes them to the edge as they launch into the treacherous 1,000-mile race across Italy, the Mille Miglia.

2024-01-15.title: Nimona
2024-01-15.synopsis: When a knight in a futuristic medieval world is framed for a crime he didn’t commit, the only one who can help him prove his innocence is Nimona — a mischievous teen who happens to be a shapeshifting creature he's sworn to destroy.

2024-01-15.title: Downfall of the Crypto King
2024-01-15.synopsis: Panorama explores the breakneck rise and sensational fall of Sam Bankman-Fried, the maths genius who set out to transform the world of crypto but ended up being its biggest loser.

2024-01-15.title: The Boy And The Heron (Dubbed)
2024-01-15.synopsis: The English dub for Hayao Miyazaki's latest adventure features an all-star cast that includes Robert Pattinson, Florence Pugh, Christian Bale, Willem Dafoe and Mark Hamill. The film follows a young boy named Mahito, who yearns for his late mother and ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There, death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. The Boy and the Heron is a dazzling, semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation.

2024-01-15.title: Anatomy of a Fall
2024-01-15.synopsis: When her husband Samuel is mysteriously found dead in the snow below their secluded chalet, Sandra becomes the main suspect when the police begin to question whether he fell or was pushed. The trial soon becomes not just an investigation, but a gripping psychological journey into the depths of Sandra and Samuel's complicated marriage. With conflicting evidence and inconsistent testimony, words are wielded like weapons and shocking truths come to light in this thrilling Palme d’Or winner.

2024-01-15.title: Maestro
2024-01-15.synopsis: Maestro is a towering and fearless love story chronicling the lifelong relationship between Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre Cohn Bernstein. A love letter to life and art, Maestro at its core is an emotionally epic portrayal of family and love.

2024-01-15.title: DocHouse: 20 Days In Mariupol
2024-01-15.synopsis:
On the eve of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine, a team of Ukrainian journalists enter the strategic eastern port city of Mariupol. During the subsequent siege and assault, as bombs fall, inhabitants flee, and access to electricity, food, water and medicine are severed, the team — the only international journalists left — struggles to cover the war and to transmit their footage out.

Ukrainian filmmaker and journalist Mstyslav Chernov offers a window into the practices of conflict zone reporters and an unflinching, anguishing account of the 20 days he and colleagues Evgeniy Maloletka and Vasilisa Stepanenko spent covering Mariupol. Chernov wonders how capturing such footage can make a difference, but residents implore them to let the world bear witness.

2024-01-15.title: DocHouse: Smoke Sauna Sisterhood
2024-01-15.synopsis:
In the warm, dense heat of a Southern Estonian smoke sauna, a group of women share their innermost secrets and intimate experiences. The rituals of the sauna envelop them, as they wash away the shame trapped in their bodies.

Filmmaker Anna Hints captures this intimate space up close, without any sense of intrusion. In the dark, enclosed space, her camera - richly lit with beams of golden daylight - frames bodies and faces in chiaroscuro, while the women give voice to their past experiences: sharing, accepting, finding laughter and solace, regaining their strength through a sense of communion.

Watching Smoke Sauna Sisterhood is a transformative experience for the viewer too, brought into a corporeal world of emotional veracity and deep empathy.

2024-01-15.title: Society of the Snow
2024-01-15.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-01-15.title: Anselm (2D)
2024-01-15.synopsis:
An experience like no other. Wim Wenders creates a portrait of Anselm Kiefer, one of the most innovative and important painters and sculptors of our time, shot in 3D and 6K-resolution. 

The film presents a total immersion in the artist’s work and practice which explores human existence and the cyclical nature of history, inspired by literature, poetry, philosophy, science, mythology and religion. For over two years, Wenders traced Kiefer’s path from his native Germany to his current home in France, connecting the stages of his life to the essential places of his career that spans more than five decades.

2024-01-16.title: Wonka
2024-01-16.synopsis: The Story will focus on a young Willy Wonka and his adventures prior to opening the world’s most famous chocolate factory.

2024-01-16.title: Chicken Run: Dawn of the Nugget
2024-01-16.synopsis: After escaping from Tweedy's farm, Ginger and all the chickens living the dream in their peaceful island sanctuary, far from the dangers of the human world.

2024-01-16.synopsis: From filmmaker Yorgos Lanthimos and producer Emma Stone comes the incredible tale and fantastical evolution of Bella Baxter (Stone), a young woman brought back to life by the brilliant and unorthodox scientist Dr. Godwin Baxter (Dafoe).

2024-01-16.title: The Kitchen

This is where we meet a solitary Izi, living here by necessity and desperately trying to find a way out, and a 12-year-old Benji, who has lost his mother and is searching for a family. 2024-01-16.title: The Boy And The Heron (Subtitled)
2024-01-16.synopsis: A young boy named Mahito yearning for his mother ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. A semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation, in tribute to friendship from the mind of Hayao Miyazaki.

2024-01-16.title: Priscilla
2024-01-16.synopsis: When teenage Priscilla Beaulieu meets Elvis Presley at a party, the man who is already a meteoric rock-and-roll superstar becomes someone entirely unexpected in private moments: a thrilling crush, an ally in loneliness, a vulnerable best friend. Through Priscilla’s eyes, Sofia Coppola tells the unseen side of a great American myth in Elvis and Priscilla's long courtship and turbulent marriage, from a German army base to his dream-world estate at Graceland, in this deeply felt and ravishingly detailed portrait of love, fantasy, and fame.

2024-01-16.title: Rustin
2024-01-16.synopsis: The architect of 1963’s momentous March on Washington, Bayard Rustin was one of the greatest activists and organizers the world has ever known. He challenged authority, never apologized for who he was, what he believed, or who he desired. And he did not back down. He made history, and in turn, he was forgotten. Directed by DGA award and five-time Tony award winner George C. Wolfe and starring Emmy award winner Colman Domingo, Rustin shines a long overdue spotlight on the extraordinary man who, alongside giants like the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr., Adam Clayton Powell Jr., and Ella Baker, dared to imagine a different world, and inspired a movement in a march toward freedom. Produced by Academy award winner Bruce Cohen, Higher Ground's Tonia Davis and George C. Wolfe, the film features an all-star cast including Chris Rock, Glynn Turman, Jeffrey Wright and Audra McDonald.

2024-01-16.title: Tótem
2024-01-16.synopsis: Seven-year-old Sol spends the day at her grandfather's home, helping with the preparations for a surprise party for her father. Throughout the day, chaos slowly takes over, fracturing the family's foundations. Sol will embrace the essence of letting go as a release for existence.

2024-01-16.title: Napoleon
2024-01-16.synopsis: Napoleon is a spectacle-filled action epic that details the checkered rise and fall of the iconic French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, played by Oscar®-winner Joaquin Phoenix. Against a stunning backdrop of large-scale filmmaking orchestrated by legendary director Ridley Scott, the film captures Bonaparte's relentless journey to power through the prism of his addictive, volatile relationship with his one true love, Josephine, showcasing his visionary military and political tactics against some of the most dynamic practical battle sequences ever filmed.

2024-01-16.title: The Boy And The Heron (Dubbed)
2024-01-16.synopsis: The English dub for Hayao Miyazaki's latest adventure features an all-star cast that includes Robert Pattinson, Florence Pugh, Christian Bale, Willem Dafoe and Mark Hamill. The film follows a young boy named Mahito, who yearns for his late mother and ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There, death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. The Boy and the Heron is a dazzling, semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation.

2024-01-16.title: Saltburn
2024-01-16.synopsis: Struggling to find his place at Oxford University, student Oliver Quick finds himself drawn into the world of the charming and aristocratic Felix Catton, who invites him to Saltburn, his eccentric family's sprawling estate, for a summer never to be forgotten.

2024-01-16.title: One Life
2024-01-16.synopsis: Follows British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

2024-01-16.title: Ferrari

Bankruptcy threatens the factory he and his wife, Laura built from nothing ten years earlier. Their volatile marriage has been battered by the loss of their son, Dino a year earlier. Ferrari struggles to acknowledge his son Piero with Lina Lardi. Meanwhile, his drivers’ passion to win pushes them to the edge as they launch into the treacherous 1,000-mile race across Italy, the Mille Miglia.

So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-01-16.title: Boys in the Boat
2024-01-16.synopsis: A 1930s-set story centered on the University of Washington's rowing team, from their Depression-era beginnings to winning gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

2024-01-16.title: Nimona
2024-01-16.synopsis: When a knight in a futuristic medieval world is framed for a crime he didn’t commit, the only one who can help him prove his innocence is Nimona — a mischievous teen who happens to be a shapeshifting creature he's sworn to destroy.

2024-01-16.title: The Killer
2024-01-16.synopsis: A man solitary and cold, methodical and unencumbered by scruples or regrets, the killer waits in the shadows, watching for his next target. And yet the longer he waits, the more he thinks he's losing his mind, if not his cool. A brutal, bloody and stylish noir story of a professional assassin lost in a world without a moral compass, this is a case study of a man alone, armed to the teeth and slowly losing his mind.

2024-01-16.title: Anatomy of a Fall
2024-01-16.synopsis: When her husband Samuel is mysteriously found dead in the snow below their secluded chalet, Sandra becomes the main suspect when the police begin to question whether he fell or was pushed. The trial soon becomes not just an investigation, but a gripping psychological journey into the depths of Sandra and Samuel's complicated marriage. With conflicting evidence and inconsistent testimony, words are wielded like weapons and shocking truths come to light in this thrilling Palme d’Or winner.

2024-01-16.title: Downfall of the Crypto King
2024-01-16.synopsis: Panorama explores the breakneck rise and sensational fall of Sam Bankman-Fried, the maths genius who set out to transform the world of crypto but ended up being its biggest loser.

2024-01-16.title: Maestro
2024-01-16.synopsis: Maestro is a towering and fearless love story chronicling the lifelong relationship between Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre Cohn Bernstein. A love letter to life and art, Maestro at its core is an emotionally epic portrayal of family and love.

2024-01-16.title: Anselm (2D)
2024-01-16.synopsis:
An experience like no other. Wim Wenders creates a portrait of Anselm Kiefer, one of the most innovative and important painters and sculptors of our time, shot in 3D and 6K-resolution. 

The film presents a total immersion in the artist’s work and practice which explores human existence and the cyclical nature of history, inspired by literature, poetry, philosophy, science, mythology and religion. For over two years, Wenders traced Kiefer’s path from his native Germany to his current home in France, connecting the stages of his life to the essential places of his career that spans more than five decades.

2024-01-16.title: Society of the Snow
2024-01-16.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-01-16.title: DocHouse: Scala!!!
2024-01-16.synopsis:
In Britain’s post-punk Thatcher years, the infamous and legendary Scala cinema showed a diverse range of films, from high art to cult classics, sexploitation, horror, Kung-Fu and LGBTQIA+. Nudging boundaries of convention, it became an inspiration for future famous creatives.

With interviews from nearly 50 contributors, previously unseen archive footage and film clips, Scala!!! is an anarchic, uproarious documentary telling the riotous inside story, with an original soundtrack by celebrated musician Barry Adamson.

Transcending nostalgia, Scala!!! is a universal testament to the power of cinemas, providing refuge and community for outsiders. A place where everyone is welcome.

2024-01-16.title: DocHouse: The Disappearance Of Shere Hite
2024-01-16.synopsis:
Feminist researcher Shere Hite changed the discussion around women's sexuality with her groundbreaking studies in the 1970s and 80s, and her books (including The Hite Report) became best-sellers. But both her methodology and her message came under criticism in the backlash from this popularity, and slowly but surely Shere was ridiculed and squeezed out of the mainstream - and eventually out of popular consciousness.

Director Nicole Newnham (Crip Camp) recovers Shere Hite from the margins of history, feminism and academia, exploring the charismatic former model's rise and fall from prominence. Using a treasure trove of archive footage, The Disappearance of Shere Hite transports viewers back to a time of great societal change and transformation around sexuality. It rediscovers a pioneer who has had an unmistakable influence on current conversations around gender and sexuality, and asks what led to Shere's erasure.

2024-01-17.title: The Kitchen
2024-01-17.synopsis: In a dystopian London, the gap between rich and poor has been stretched to its limits. All forms of social housing have been eradicated and only The Kitchen remains. A community that refuses to move out of the place they call home. This is where we meet a solitary Izi, living here by necessity and desperately trying to find a way out, and a 12-year-old Benji, who has lost his mother and is searching for a family. We follow our unlikely pair as they struggle to forge a relationship in a system that is stacked against them.

He challenged authority, never apologized for who he was, what he believed, or who he desired. And he did not back down. He made history, and in turn, he was forgotten. Directed by DGA award and five-time Tony award winner George C. Wolfe and starring Emmy award winner Colman Domingo, Rustin shines a long overdue spotlight on the extraordinary man who, alongside giants like the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr., Adam Clayton Powell Jr., and Ella Baker, dared to imagine a different world, and inspired a movement in a march toward freedom. Produced by Academy award winner Bruce Cohen, Higher Ground's Tonia Davis and George C. Wolfe, the film features an all-star cast including Chris Rock, Glynn Turman, Jeffrey Wright and Audra McDonald.

2024-01-17.title: The Holdovers
2024-01-17.synopsis: From acclaimed director Alexander Payne, The Holdovers follows a curmudgeonly teacher (Paul Giamatti) at a New England prep school who is forced to remain on campus during the holidays to babysit the handful of students with nowhere to go. Eventually he forms an unlikely bond with one of them -- a damaged, brainy troublemaker (newcomer Dominic Sessa) -- and with the school’s head cook, who lost a son in Vietnam (Da’Vine Joy Randolph). With outstanding critical acclaim, The Holdovers is now the winner of 2 Golden Globes for Best Actor (Comedy) for Paul Giamatti and Best Supporting Actress for Da’Vine Joy Randolph.

2024-01-17.title: Chicken Run: Dawn of the Nugget
2024-01-17.synopsis: After escaping from Tweedy's farm, Ginger and all the chickens living the dream in their peaceful island sanctuary, far from the dangers of the human world.

2024-01-17.title: DocHouse: The Disappearance Of Shere Hite
2024-01-17.synopsis:
Feminist researcher Shere Hite changed the discussion around women's sexuality with her groundbreaking studies in the 1970s and 80s, and her books (including The Hite Report) became best-sellers. But both her methodology and her message came under criticism in the backlash from this popularity, and slowly but surely Shere was ridiculed and squeezed out of the mainstream - and eventually out of popular consciousness.

Director Nicole Newnham (Crip Camp) recovers Shere Hite from the margins of history, feminism and academia, exploring the charismatic former model's rise and fall from prominence. Using a treasure trove of archive footage, The Disappearance of Shere Hite transports viewers back to a time of great societal change and transformation around sexuality. It rediscovers a pioneer who has had an unmistakable influence on current conversations around gender and sexuality, and asks what led to Shere's erasure.

2024-01-17.title: DocHouse: Art Talent Show
2024-01-17.synopsis:
At the Prague Academy of Fine Arts, it's time for a new batch of potential students to go through the 3-day entrance exam process. The Academy's tutors prepare to put them through their paces and whittle down hundreds of hopefuls for a few coveted spots.

They will question their artistic beliefs as well as their talents, push them out of their comfort zones, encourage debate and travel with them through the highs and lows of the most important three days of their burgeoning careers.

The whole process is brilliantly observed with droll detachment by filmmakers Adéla Komrzý and Tomáš Bojar, who have created their own artistic masterpiece - landing somewhere between Ruben Östlund and Frederick Wiseman.

How do you assess artistic talent? Who gets to select the artists of the future? What role can art play in today's world? And what is the best theme for the Day 2 practical exam?

2024-01-17.title: DocHouse: Scala!!!
2024-01-17.synopsis:
In Britain’s post-punk Thatcher years, the infamous and legendary Scala cinema showed a diverse range of films, from high art to cult classics, sexploitation, horror, Kung-Fu and LGBTQIA+. Nudging boundaries of convention, it became an inspiration for future famous creatives.

With interviews from nearly 50 contributors, previously unseen archive footage and film clips, Scala!!! is an anarchic, uproarious documentary telling the riotous inside story, with an original soundtrack by celebrated musician Barry Adamson.

Transcending nostalgia, Scala!!! is a universal testament to the power of cinemas, providing refuge and community for outsiders. A place where everyone is welcome.

2024-01-18.title: Poor Things
2024-01-18.synopsis: From filmmaker Yorgos Lanthimos and producer Emma Stone comes the incredible tale and fantastical evolution of Bella Baxter (Stone), a young woman brought back to life by the brilliant and unorthodox scientist Dr. Godwin Baxter (Dafoe).

2024-01-18.title: The Kitchen
2024-01-18.synopsis: In a dystopian London, the gap between rich and poor has been stretched to its limits. All forms of social housing have been eradicated and only The Kitchen remains. A community that refuses to move out of the place they call home. This is where we meet a solitary Izi, living here by necessity and desperately trying to find a way out, and a 12-year-old Benji, who has lost his mother and is searching for a family. We follow our unlikely pair as they struggle to forge a relationship in a system that is stacked against them.

2024-01-18.title: The Boy And The Heron (Subtitled)
2024-01-18.synopsis: A young boy named Mahito yearning for his mother ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. A semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation, in tribute to friendship from the mind of Hayao Miyazaki.

2024-01-18.title: Priscilla
2024-01-18.synopsis: When teenage Priscilla Beaulieu meets Elvis Presley at a party, the man who is already a meteoric rock-and-roll superstar becomes someone entirely unexpected in private moments: a thrilling crush, an ally in loneliness, a vulnerable best friend. Through Priscilla’s eyes, Sofia Coppola tells the unseen side of a great American myth in Elvis and Priscilla's long courtship and turbulent marriage, from a German army base to his dream-world estate at Graceland, in this deeply felt and ravishingly detailed portrait of love, fantasy, and fame.

2024-01-18.title: Napoleon
2024-01-18.synopsis: Napoleon is a spectacle-filled action epic that details the checkered rise and fall of the iconic French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte, played by Oscar®-winner Joaquin Phoenix. Against a stunning backdrop of large-scale filmmaking orchestrated by legendary director Ridley Scott, the film captures Bonaparte's relentless journey to power through the prism of his addictive, volatile relationship with his one true love, Josephine, showcasing his visionary military and political tactics against some of the most dynamic practical battle sequences ever filmed.

2024-01-18.title: Rustin
2024-01-18.synopsis: The architect of 1963’s momentous March on Washington, Bayard Rustin was one of the greatest activists and organizers the world has ever known. He challenged authority, never apologized for who he was, what he believed, or who he desired. And he did not back down. He made history, and in turn, he was forgotten. Directed by DGA award and five-time Tony award winner George C. Wolfe and starring Emmy award winner Colman Domingo, Rustin shines a long overdue spotlight on the extraordinary man who, alongside giants like the Reverend Martin Luther King Jr., Adam Clayton Powell Jr., and Ella Baker, dared to imagine a different world, and inspired a movement in a march toward freedom. Produced by Academy award winner Bruce Cohen, Higher Ground's Tonia Davis and George C. Wolfe, the film features an all-star cast including Chris Rock, Glynn Turman, Jeffrey Wright and Audra McDonald.

2024-01-18.title: Saltburn
2024-01-18.synopsis: Struggling to find his place at Oxford University, student Oliver Quick finds himself drawn into the world of the charming and aristocratic Felix Catton, who invites him to Saltburn, his eccentric family's sprawling estate, for a summer never to be forgotten.

2024-01-18.title: The Boy And The Heron (Dubbed)
2024-01-18.synopsis: The English dub for Hayao Miyazaki's latest adventure features an all-star cast that includes Robert Pattinson, Florence Pugh, Christian Bale, Willem Dafoe and Mark Hamill. The film follows a young boy named Mahito, who yearns for his late mother and ventures into a world shared by the living and the dead. There, death comes to an end, and life finds a new beginning. The Boy and the Heron is a dazzling, semi-autobiographical fantasy about life, death and creation.

2024-01-18.title: One Life
2024-01-18.synopsis: Follows British humanitarian Nicholas Winton, who helped save hundreds of children from the Nazis on the eve of World War II.

2024-01-18.title: Ferrari
2024-01-18.synopsis: It is the summer of 1957. Behind the spectacle of Formula 1, ex-racer Enzo Ferrari is in crisis. Bankruptcy threatens the factory he and his wife, Laura built from nothing ten years earlier. Their volatile marriage has been battered by the loss of their son, Dino a year earlier. Ferrari struggles to acknowledge his son Piero with Lina Lardi. Meanwhile, his drivers’ passion to win pushes them to the edge as they launch into the treacherous 1,000-mile race across Italy, the Mille Miglia.

2024-01-18.title: Anyone But You
2024-01-18.synopsis: In the comedy Anyone But You, Bea (Sydney Sweeney) and Ben (Glen Powell) look like the perfect couple, but after an amazing first date something happens that turns their fiery hot attraction ice cold - until they find themselves unexpectedly thrust together at a destination wedding in Australia. So they do what any two mature adults would do: pretend to be a couple.

2024-01-18.title: Boys in the Boat
2024-01-18.synopsis: A 1930s-set story centered on the University of Washington's rowing team, from their Depression-era beginnings to winning gold at the 1936 Berlin Olympics.

2024-01-18.title: Nimona
2024-01-18.synopsis: When a knight in a futuristic medieval world is framed for a crime he didn’t commit, the only one who can help him prove his innocence is Nimona — a mischievous teen who happens to be a shapeshifting creature he's sworn to destroy.

2024-01-18.title: The Killer
2024-01-18.synopsis: A man solitary and cold, methodical and unencumbered by scruples or regrets, the killer waits in the shadows, watching for his next target. And yet the longer he waits, the more he thinks he's losing his mind, if not his cool. A brutal, bloody and stylish noir story of a professional assassin lost in a world without a moral compass, this is a case study of a man alone, armed to the teeth and slowly losing his mind.

2024-01-18.title: Downfall of the Crypto King
2024-01-18.synopsis: Panorama explores the breakneck rise and sensational fall of Sam Bankman-Fried, the maths genius who set out to transform the world of crypto but ended up being its biggest loser.

2024-01-18.title: Anatomy of a Fall
2024-01-18.synopsis: When her husband Samuel is mysteriously found dead in the snow below their secluded chalet, Sandra becomes the main suspect when the police begin to question whether he fell or was pushed. The trial soon becomes not just an investigation, but a gripping psychological journey into the depths of Sandra and Samuel's complicated marriage. With conflicting evidence and inconsistent testimony, words are wielded like weapons and shocking truths come to light in this thrilling Palme d’Or winner.

2024-01-18.title: Maestro
2024-01-18.synopsis: Maestro is a towering and fearless love story chronicling the lifelong relationship between Leonard Bernstein and Felicia Montealegre Cohn Bernstein. A love letter to life and art, Maestro at its core is an emotionally epic portrayal of family and love.

2024-01-18.title: Anselm (2D)
2024-01-18.synopsis:
An experience like no other. Wim Wenders creates a portrait of Anselm Kiefer, one of the most innovative and important painters and sculptors of our time, shot in 3D and 6K-resolution. 

The film presents a total immersion in the artist’s work and practice which explores human existence and the cyclical nature of history, inspired by literature, poetry, philosophy, science, mythology and religion. For over two years, Wenders traced Kiefer’s path from his native Germany to his current home in France, connecting the stages of his life to the essential places of his career that spans more than five decades.

2024-01-18.title: Society of the Snow
2024-01-18.synopsis: The flight of a rugby team crashes on a glacier in the Andes, few passengers who survived the crash, find themselves in one of the world's toughest environments to survive.

2024-01-18.title: DocHouse: Art Talent Show
2024-01-18.synopsis:
At the Prague Academy of Fine Arts, it's time for a new batch of potential students to go through the 3-day entrance exam process. The Academy's tutors prepare to put them through their paces and whittle down hundreds of hopefuls for a few coveted spots.

They will question their artistic beliefs as well as their talents, push them out of their comfort zones, encourage debate and travel with them through the highs and lows of the most important three days of their burgeoning careers.

The whole process is brilliantly observed with droll detachment by filmmakers Adéla Komrzý and Tomáš Bojar, who have created their own artistic masterpiece - landing somewhere between Ruben Östlund and Frederick Wiseman.

How do you assess artistic talent? Who gets to select the artists of the future? What role can art play in today's world? And what is the best theme for the Day 2 practical exam?

2024-01-18.title: DocHouse: No Holds Barred
2024-01-18.synopsis:
No Holds Barred reaches into the remarkable life of Matthew Lanyon, the late Cornish artist whose reclusive, comedic disposition disguised a fierce dedication to art, powered by learning, love and loss. He was the third child of Peter Lanyon, the internationally acclaimed modernist painter from St Ives who died tragically following a gliding accident in the summer of Matthew’s 13th birthday.

This intimate film, co-directed by Judith Lanyon, Matthew's widow, along with Cornish filmmaker Barbara Santi, draws on his own words and paintings, his rich collection of unseen short films and recordings, and the breathtaking geology of West Cornwall. Matthew’s close family, collectors and collaborators speak in newly filmed interviews about a complex man with visionary talent, courage and skill for whom art and life were one.

2024-01-18.title: DocHouse: The Disappearance Of Shere Hite
2024-01-18.synopsis:
Feminist researcher Shere Hite changed the discussion around women's sexuality with her groundbreaking studies in the 1970s and 80s, and her books (including The Hite Report) became best-sellers. But both her methodology and her message came under criticism in the backlash from this popularity, and slowly but surely Shere was ridiculed and squeezed out of the mainstream - and eventually out of popular consciousness.

Director Nicole Newnham (Crip Camp) recovers Shere Hite from the margins of history, feminism and academia, exploring the charismatic former model's rise and fall from prominence. Using a treasure trove of archive footage, The Disappearance of Shere Hite transports viewers back to a time of great societal change and transformation around sexuality. It rediscovers a pioneer who has had an unmistakable influence on current conversations around gender and sexuality, and asks what led to Shere's erasure.

2024-01-19.title: DocHouse: Rojek
2024-01-19.synopsis:
Filmmaker Zaynê Akyol puts a face to the often disembodied threat of Islamic State (ISIS). In prison camps in Syria, Akyol encounters dozens of detained IS fighters, men and women, who share a common dream: establishing a caliphate.

Confronted with their fundamentalist beliefs, Rojek attempts to trace the beginning, the rise and fall of ISIS through their personal stories. These up-close, unsettling interviews are set against imagery filmed around decimated, post-war Syrian Kurdistan.

This films offers an intimate, uncomfortable gaze at a complex, unknown reality, pointing to an ideological war that extends well beyond the 'fall of ISIS'.

2024-01-19.title: DocHouse: Werner Herzog: Radical Dreamer
2024-01-19.synopsis:
Filmmaker, auteur, poet, actor, doomsayer, truth seeker - Werner Herzog has become a legend in his own right, and at 81 still continues to add to his considerable oeuvre.


Radical Dreamer profiles the man who had a 320-ton steamboat hauled over a hill in Peru, who hypnotises his actors, climbs down into volcanoes, talks to murderers on death row, cooks and eats his own shoe and who once - in an almost magical act - walked from Munich to Paris to prevent the death of a film critic he greatly admired. It is stories like these that have made this most remarkable director a cult figure the world over.

This comprehensive portrait by director Thomas von Steinaecke explores Herzog's work, process and everyday life, bringing together rare archive materials and in-depth interviews with the man himself, as well as celebrated collaborators - including Joshua Oppenheimer, Patti Smith, Christian Bale, Nicole Kidman and his wife, Lena Herzog.

2024-01-20.title: LSFF 2024: Romantic Matinee
2024-01-20.synopsis:
Is there a theme more eternal than love? We fall for each other, our hearts flutter. We taste jealousy, cry over breakups, and yet we are rejuvenated by another encounter. Life feels like its fullest when yearning is balanced with regrets, peppered with quarrels, brimming with endless possibilities that need not to be realised. Love is most beautiful at its imperfection. 

That letdown when you thought you were their first. That moment strikes when you decide to call your estranged best mate and reconciliate. That excitement of speed-driving, at dawn, on uncannily empty streets of post-war Kyiv, to get to someone. The beaming self-love of an aging middle-age woman; an enchanted musical of a happily married, a childless couple running a mobile marry-go-round; an enigmatic AI love story, a brief one-night stand that turns emotional. To love and its entangled fuzz! 

Programme: 
– It’s a Date, dir. Nadia Parfan, Ukraine 2023, 6mins
– Basri & Salma in a Never-Ending Comedy, dir. Khozy Rizal, Indonesia 2023, 15mins
– Tall Dark and Handsome, dir. Sam Baron, UK 2022, 14mins
– Room For One More, dir. Jesse Vogelaar, Australia 2023, 7mins
– Return To Youth, dir. Mel Sangyi Zhao, China 2023, 17mins
– E6-D7, dir. Eno Swinnen, Belgium 2023, 16mins
– Nothing Special, dir. Mikko Makela, UK 2023, 14mins

2024-01-20.title: Samsara
2024-01-20.synopsis: Samsara is the Buddhist cycle of death and reincarnation. From the temples of Laos, alongside with teenage monks, we will accompany a soul in its transit from one body to another through the bardo. The words of the "Tibetan Book of the Dead" will be our guide to avoid getting lost in the afterlife. A luminous and sonorous journey that will lead us to reincarnate on the beaches of Zanzibar, where groups of women work in seaweed farms.

2024-01-20.title: The Color Purple
2024-01-20.synopsis: Produced by Oprah Winfrey, Steven Spielberg, Scott Sanders and Quincy Jones, THE COLOR PURPLE is a bold new take on the classic story of love and resilience, adapted from the beloved novel and the Broadway musical. Torn apart from her sister and her children, Celie faces many hardships in her life, but ultimately learns to find extraordinary strength in the unbreakable bonds of a new kind of sisterhood.

2024-01-20.title: Kids Club: The Canterville Ghost
2024-01-20.synopsis:
In this vivid adaptation of Oscar Wilde’s classic children’s story, the ghost of Sir Simon Canterville (Stephen Fry) has been roaming his castle for centuries, searching for a descendant who can release him from his curse by performing a brave deed.  The only problem is – he keeps scaring them away!  
Finally, a family move in who refuse to be startled, and Sir Simon is able to tell his tale to the inquisitive and courageous Virgina (Emily Carey).  Can the two of them survive The Ghost Catcher (Miranda Hart), and The Reverend (Toby Jones), to bring balance to the house and set Sir Simon free?
Signature Entertainment presents The Canterville Ghost only in cinemas September 22.

2024-01-20.title: DocHouse: Rojek
2024-01-20.synopsis:
Filmmaker Zaynê Akyol puts a face to the often disembodied threat of Islamic State (ISIS). In prison camps in Syria, Akyol encounters dozens of detained IS fighters, men and women, who share a common dream: establishing a caliphate.

Confronted with their fundamentalist beliefs, Rojek attempts to trace the beginning, the rise and fall of ISIS through their personal stories. These up-close, unsettling interviews are set against imagery filmed around decimated, post-war Syrian Kurdistan.

This films offers an intimate, uncomfortable gaze at a complex, unknown reality, pointing to an ideological war that extends well beyond the 'fall of ISIS'.

2024-01-20.title: DocHouse: Werner Herzog: Radical Dreamer
2024-01-20.synopsis:
Filmmaker, auteur, poet, actor, doomsayer, truth seeker - Werner Herzog has become a legend in his own right, and at 81 still continues to add to his considerable oeuvre.


Radical Dreamer profiles the man who had a 320-ton steamboat hauled over a hill in Peru, who hypnotises his actors, climbs down into volcanoes, talks to murderers on death row, cooks and eats his own shoe and who once - in an almost magical act - walked from Munich to Paris to prevent the death of a film critic he greatly admired. It is stories like these that have made this most remarkable director a cult figure the world over.

This comprehensive portrait by director Thomas von Steinaecke explores Herzog's work, process and everyday life, bringing together rare archive materials and in-depth interviews with the man himself, as well as celebrated collaborators - including Joshua Oppenheimer, Patti Smith, Christian Bale, Nicole Kidman and his wife, Lena Herzog.

2024-01-21.title: The Color Purple
2024-01-21.synopsis: Produced by Oprah Winfrey, Steven Spielberg, Scott Sanders and Quincy Jones, THE COLOR PURPLE is a bold new take on the classic story of love and resilience, adapted from the beloved novel and the Broadway musical. Torn apart from her sister and her children, Celie faces many hardships in her life, but ultimately learns to find extraordinary strength in the unbreakable bonds of a new kind of sisterhood.

2024-01-21.title: Samsara
2024-01-21.synopsis: Samsara is the Buddhist cycle of death and reincarnation. From the temples of Laos, alongside with teenage monks, we will accompany a soul in its transit from one body to another through the bardo. The words of the "Tibetan Book of the Dead" will be our guide to avoid getting lost in the afterlife. A luminous and sonorous journey that will lead us to reincarnate on the beaches of Zanzibar, where groups of women work in seaweed farms.

2024-01-21.title: LSFF 2024: Documentary: Journey To Earth
2024-01-21.synopsis:
It doesn’t matter where you’re watching from - a film can tell you when you’ve left the comfort of home and crossed a threshold into the strange and remote. A vast, unearthly landscape will transport you thousands of miles across deserts and oceans; the grain of archival footage can take you to this exact spot, 70 years ago.

From a haunted tour of the pea-soup fog in 1950s London to the depths of a primeval Finnish forest, up through the clouds into a space graveyard and back down onto a small commuter ferry, join us on 6 journeys across time and space on our pale blue dot. Don’t forget your lederhosen. 

Programme:
– Heimatfilm, dir. Marion Kellmann, Germany 2023, 16mins 
– The Veiled City, dir. Natalie Cubides-Brady, UK 2022, 13mins
– The empty sphere, dir. Stephanie Roland, Russia 2022, 19mins
– Immaterial Terrain, dir. Emily Richardson, UK 2023, 8mins 
– Aqueronte, dir. Manuel Muñoz Rivas, Spain 2023, 25mins
– Scenic View, dir. Maija Blåfield, Finland 2023, 16mins

2024-01-21.title: A Brighter Tomorrow
2024-01-21.synopsis: Giovanni, a renowned Italian filmmaker, is about to start shooting a political film. But between his marriage in crisis, his co-producer on the verge of bankruptcy and the rapidly changing film industry, everything seems to be working against him! Always on the edge, Giovanni will have to rethink his way of doing things if he wants to lead his little world towards a bright tomorrow.

2024-01-21.title: Dr. Strangelove
2024-01-21.synopsis:
Stanley Kubrick's celebrated satire centres on an insane general who triggers a path to nuclear holocaust that a War Room full of politicians and military men frantically tries to stop. It stars Peter Sellers as an RAF officer, the President of the USA and the mysterious scientist Dr. Strangelove, one of cinema's most unique comic creations.

This special screening celebrates the publication of Robert P. Kolker and Nathan Abrams' Kubrick: An Odyssey (Faber and Faber), the first full-length biography of Kubrick in 20 years and the most comprehensive to date. Copies of the book will be available to buy on the day, courtesy of the London Review Bookshop.

2024-01-21.title: DocHouse: Rojek
2024-01-21.synopsis:
Filmmaker Zaynê Akyol puts a face to the often disembodied threat of Islamic State (ISIS). In prison camps in Syria, Akyol encounters dozens of detained IS fighters, men and women, who share a common dream: establishing a caliphate.

Confronted with their fundamentalist beliefs, Rojek attempts to trace the beginning, the rise and fall of ISIS through their personal stories. These up-close, unsettling interviews are set against imagery filmed around decimated, post-war Syrian Kurdistan.

This films offers an intimate, uncomfortable gaze at a complex, unknown reality, pointing to an ideological war that extends well beyond the 'fall of ISIS'.

2024-01-22.title: LSFF 2024: Present Artefacts
2024-01-22.synopsis:
History is often seen as an indisputable narrative of the past. This programme reminds us that the narrative has a narrator. Who are the ghosts that haunt us, waiting for us to find them, to tell their story? From mockumentary to historic fiction to nostalgic fantasy, these films take us back – and reframe.
 
A reclusive woman in Brooklyn reveals the truth behind electronic music - it was started by Black musicians in the 1920s South. A young woman becomes obsessed with some old photographs of female Arab crossdressers, a filmmaker reconstructs memories with a monk’s long forgotten photographs in a timeless Mount Athos, a found footage film collage collects perceptions of death and hell in religious filter bubbles, a Byzantine farmer accused of heresy is locked in a pillory and forgotten as war rages in the unseen background, and a travelling court jester’s joke spirals into horror in 16th century England.  

Programme: 
– Africans With Mainframes, dir. Kima Hibbert, USA 2023, 15mins
– Neo Nahda, dir. May Ziadé, UK 2023, 12mins
– Light of Light, dir. Neritan Zinxhiria, Greece 2022, 13mins
– Lake Of Fire, dir. Art Collective NEOZOON, Germany 2022, 11mins
– Unorthodox, dir. Konstantinos Antonopoulos, Greece 2022, 23mins
– The Licensed Fool, dir. Gareth Bowen, UK 2023, 17mins

2024-01-22.title: DocHouse: Rojek
2024-01-22.synopsis:
Filmmaker Zaynê Akyol puts a face to the often disembodied threat of Islamic State (ISIS). In prison camps in Syria, Akyol encounters dozens of detained IS fighters, men and women, who share a common dream: establishing a caliphate.

Confronted with their fundamentalist beliefs, Rojek attempts to trace the beginning, the rise and fall of ISIS through their personal stories. These up-close, unsettling interviews are set against imagery filmed around decimated, post-war Syrian Kurdistan.

This films offers an intimate, uncomfortable gaze at a complex, unknown reality, pointing to an ideological war that extends well beyond the 'fall of ISIS'.

2024-01-22.title: Perfect Days
2024-01-22.synopsis: Hirayama seems utterly content with his simple life as a cleaner of toilets in Tokyo. Outside of his very structured everyday routine he enjoys his passion for music and for books. And he loves trees and takes photos of them. A series of unexpected encounters gradually reveal more of his past. A deeply moving and poetic reflection on finding beauty in the everyday world around us.
